definition: to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: Then suddenly they vanished behind a great clump of trees growing in the middle of the Hippodrome .
sentences.chinese: 然后他们突然被跑马场中间的一大片树丛遮挡住了。

sentences.english: The horse paced around the ring.
sentences.chinese: 那匹马在跑马场的四周溜蹄。

sentences.english: Western Anatolian dancers perform at the Hippodrome.
sentences.chinese: 古罗马跑马场里来自安纳托利亚高原西部的舞者。

sentences.english: They arrived on the horse court at two.
sentences.chinese: 两点钟时他们抵达跑马场。

sentences.english: She told him she had won the money on a horse .
sentences.chinese: 她对他说，那笔钱是她在跑马场买彩票赢来的。

sentences.english: Then we drove to Race court to have lunch.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们开车去了跑马场吃午饭。

sentences.english: The heavy rain made the course ride soft .
sentences.chinese: 大雨使那个跑马场变得松软。
